titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Albert Theodore Lang (1881-1956) was an Oiler on the USS Olympia and a member of the ship's baseball team. He wife was Emilie Pauline Lang. Their son, Charles Lang, served in the U.S. Navy during World War II.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Albert Lang. Materials include: correspondence and other documents of Albert Lang and Emilie Lang from the Navy Department related to retirement and veteran's benefits; service records including orders, appointments, changes of duty, and discharges, 1914-1947, including a certificate of appointment to the USS Olympia as Oiler, 1909; correspondence between Albert Lang and his sister, 1899 and 1921; Albert and Emilie Lang's marriage certificate; correspondence from the Cruiser Olympia Association; and clippings related to the Olympia, circa 1959. Photos in the collection include: portrait photographs, cabinet card photos, and photo postcards of Albert Lang and other sailors, World War I period; reproduction photographs of the USS Olympia baseball team (Lang was a member of the team); photos of a war-damaged town (World War I period, unlabeled); panoramic photo of Company 1328 Civilian Conservation Corps at Sunnamahoning, Pennsylvania, 1933; panoramic photo of the crew of the USS New Jersey, 1913; and commemorative photos of ships USS Indiana, USS New Hampshire, and others. Other materials in the collection include: programs, menus, and other ephemera from events on board various ships, including the USS New Hampshire, the USS Nebraska, and the USS Pennsylvania; and miscellaneous printed volumes and souvenir booklets. The collection also includes a letter related to Albert's son, Charles, attempt to enroll in the U.S. Naval Academy and a copy of a report of physical examination.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
